measured_by: η parameter of the diffusion decision model
justification: “Their findings indicated that only a diffusion model with a non-zero η parameter – the standard deviation of the random between-trial variability in drift rate – could generate the observed trends, which they claimed to ‘provide direct evidence that external noise is, in fact, required…’”
construct: random between-trial variability in drift rate / external noise

justification: “Ratcliff et al. (2018) conducted five different double-pass experiments… [and] assessed whether a diffusion model could explain the level of agreement between these identical trials,” using the agreement between the two passes to detect variability.

measured_by: ρ_v parameter (correlation in drift rate between double-pass trials)
justification: “…the η²_v parameter determines whether or not between-trial variability in drift rate exists, and the ρ_v parameter determines what type of between-trial variability exists.”
construct: type of between-trial variability (systematic vs. random)
